Typealiases.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient23U.name: UserStateChangeCallback
Typealiases.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient23U.abstract: Callback type when registered to notifications for change in UserState. The dictionary contains information like provider which the user signed in with.

Structs/Device.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient.name: deviceKey
Structs/Device.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient.abstract: The service generated unique identifier for device.

Structs/Device.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient.name: lastAuthenticatedDate
Structs/Device.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient.abstract: The date this device was last authenticated.

Structs/Device.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient.name: lastModifiedDate
Structs/Device.html#/s:15AWSMobileClient.abstract: The date this device was last updated.

Structs/SignOutOptions.html#/s:15AWSMobi.name: init(signOutGlobally:invalidateTokens:)
Structs/SignOutOptions.html#/s:15AWSMobi.abstract: Initializer: Signout options to change the default behavior.

Structs/SessionToken.html.name: SessionToken
Structs/SessionToken.html.abstract: Contains the token string and the claims for the token.

Structs/Tokens.html.name: Tokens
Structs/Tokens.html.abstract: Contains the tokens for an active sign in session.

Structs/SignOutOptions.html.name: SignOutOptions
Structs/SignOutOptions.html.abstract: Signout options to change the default behavior.

Structs/HostedUIOptions.html.name: HostedUIOptions
Structs/HostedUIOptions.html.abstract: The options object for showSignIn API when using Hosted Auth solution like Amazon Cognito UserPools or AUth0.

Structs/ForgotPasswordResult.html.name: ForgotPasswordResult
Structs/ForgotPasswordResult.html.abstract: Contains the result of the forgot password operation.

Structs/SignInResult.html.name: SignInResult
Structs/SignInResult.html.abstract: Contains the result of the sign in operation.

Structs/SignUpResult.html.name: SignUpResult
Structs/SignUpResult.html.abstract: Contains the result of the sign up operation.

Structs/UserCodeDeliveryDetails.html.name: UserCodeDeliveryDetails
Structs/UserCodeDeliveryDetails.html.abstract: Contains the details about where a code was sent to the user.

Structs/Device.html.name: Device
Structs/Device.html.abstract: The structure that holds information about a device.

Enums/AWSMobileClientError.html#/s:15AWS.name: makeMobileClientError(from:)
Enums/AWSMobileClientError.html#/s:15AWS.abstract: Utility class which maps a service error to AWSMobileClientError. If no mapping is available, returns the original error.

Enums/AWSMobileClientError.html#/s:15AWS.name: makeMobileClientError(from:)
Enums/AWSMobileClientError.html#/s:15AWS.abstract: Utility class which maps a cognito error to AWSMobileClientError.

Enums/SignInState.html.name: SignInState
Enums/SignInState.html.abstract: Indicates sign in state of the user in the sign in process.

Enums/ForgotPasswordState.html.name: ForgotPasswordState
Enums/ForgotPasswordState.html.abstract: Indicates the state of forgot password operation.

Enums/SignUpConfirmationState.html.name: SignUpConfirmationState
Enums/SignUpConfirmationState.html.abstract: Indicates the state of user during the sign up operation.

Enums/UserCodeDeliveryMedium.html.name: UserCodeDeliveryMedium
Enums/UserCodeDeliveryMedium.html.abstract: Describes the medium through which a code was sent to the user.

Classes/DeviceOperations.html#/s:15AWSMo.name: forget(_:)
Classes/DeviceOperations.html#/s:15AWSMo.abstract: Forget current device. The device will no longer be tracked. Note: Calling updateStatus to remember the device after calling forget device will result in error. To remember a forgotten device, the user needs to re-login.

Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/c:@M@AWSMo.name: canCancel
Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/c:@M@AWSMo.abstract: If true, the end user can cancel the sign-in operation and go back to previous view controller.

Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: logoImage
Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The logo image to be displayed on the sign-in screen.

Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: backgroundColor
Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The background color of the sign-in screen.

Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: secondaryBackgroundColor
Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The secondary background color. It’s applied to the bottom panel of the sign-in screen.

Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: primaryColor
Classes/SignInUIOptions.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The view primary color used for highlighted elements (button background, links).

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: currentUserState
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Returns the current state of user. If MobileClient is not initialized, it will return unknown

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: deviceOperations
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: username
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Returns the username of the logged in user, nil otherwise.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: identityId
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The identity id associated with this provider. This value will be fetched from the keychain at startup. If you do not want to reuse the existing identity id, you must call the clearKeychain method. If the identityId is not fetched yet, it will return nil. Use getIdentityId() method to force a server fetch when identityId is not available.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: isSignedIn
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Returns true if there is a user currently signed in.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: sharedInstance()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The singleton instance of AWSMobileClient.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: default()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: The default instance of AWSMobileClient. The configuration is loaded from the awsconfiguration.json file.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: handleAuthResponse(_:open:sourceApplication:annotation:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: initialize(_:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Initializes AWSMobileClient and determines the UserState for current user using cache.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: addUserStateListener(_:_:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Adds a listener who receives notifications on user state change.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: removeUserStateListener(_:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Removes a registered listener. If no listener exists, call is ignored.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: showSignIn(navigationController:signInUIOptions:hostedUIOptions:_:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Shows a fully managed sign in screen which allows users to sign up and sign in.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: credentials()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Asynchronously returns a valid AWS credentials or an error object if it cannot retrieve valid credentials. It should cache valid credentials as much as possible and refresh them when they are invalid.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: invalidateCachedTemporaryCredentials()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Invalidates the cached temporary AWS credentials. If the credentials provider does not cache temporary credentials, this operation is a no-op.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: getIdentityId()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Get/retrieve the identity id for this provider. If an identity id is already set on this provider, no remote call is made and the identity will be returned as a result of the AWSTask (the identityId is also available as a property). If no identityId is set on this provider, one will be retrieved from the service.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: clearCredentials()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Clear the cached AWS credentials for this provider.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: clearKeychain()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Clear ALL saved values for this provider (identityId, credentials, logins).

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: logins()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Each entry in logins represents a single login with an identity provider. The key is the domain of the login provider (e.g. ‘graph.facebook.com’) and the value is the OAuth/OpenId Connect token that results from an authentication with that login provider.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: signIn(username:password:validationData:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Signs in a user with the given username and password.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: federatedSignIn(providerName:token:federatedSignInOptions:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Federates a social provider like Google, Facebook, Amazon or Twitter.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: signUp(username:password:userAttributes:validationData:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Sign up with username, password and other attrbutes like phone, email.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: confirmSignUp(username:confirmationCode:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Confirms a sign up for a user using a verification code.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: resendSignUpCode(username:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Re-sends the sign up code to the user via email or phone_number.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: forgotPassword(username:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: When called, will send a confirmation code to user which can be used to reset the password.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: confirmForgotPassword(username:newPassword:confirmationCode:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Resets the password for the user if they have a valid confirmation code using the specified new password.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: signOut(options:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Asynchronous signout method which requires network activity. Based on the options specified in SignOutOptions, appropriate tasks will be performed.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: signOut()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Signs out the current logged in user and clears the local keychain store.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: confirmSignIn(challengeResponse:userAttributes:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Confirm a sign in which requires additional validation via steps like SMS MFA.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: changePassword(currentPassword:proposedPassword:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Change password of a logged in user.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: getAWSCredentials(_:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Fetches the AWSCredentials asynchronously.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: releaseSignInWait()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Invoke this function to release any sign-in waits.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: getTokens(_:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Returns cached UserPools auth JWT tokens if valid.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: verifyUserAttribute(attributeName:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Verify a user attribute like phone_number.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: updateUserAttributes(attributeMap:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Update the attributes for a user.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: getUserAttributes(completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Fetches the attributes for logged in user.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: confirmUpdateUserAttributes(attributeName:code:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Confirm the updated attributes using a confirmation code.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: confirmVerifyUserAttribute(attributeName:code:completionHandler:)
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Confirm the attribute using a confirmation code.

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: getViewController()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.name: shouldLaunchSignInVCIfRefreshTokenIsExpired()
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html#/s:15AWSMob.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/AWSMobileClient.html.name: AWSMobileClient
Classes/AWSMobileClient.html.abstract: AWSMobileClient is used for all auth related operations when your app is accessing AWS backend.

Classes/SignInUIOptions.html.name: SignInUIOptions
Classes/SignInUIOptions.html.abstract: The options object for drop-in UI which allows changing properties like logo image and background color.

Classes/DeviceOperations.html.name: DeviceOperations
Classes/DeviceOperations.html.abstract: DeviceOperations is responsible for handling mobile device related operations for logged in user.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
